dt.t: {it}depleting{/it} the country of its natural resources

dt: {bc}to lessen markedly in quantity, content, power, or value

pt: {sc}deplete{/sc} {sc}drain{/sc} {sc}exhaust{/sc} {sc}impoverish{/sc} {sc}bankrupt{/sc} mean to deprive of something essential to existence or potency. {sc}deplete{/sc} implies a reduction in number or quantity so as to endanger the ability to function.
{sc}drain{/sc} implies a gradual withdrawal and ultimate deprivation of what is necessary to an existence.

pt.t: personal tragedy had {it}drained{/it} him of all spirit

pt: {sc}impoverish{/sc} suggests a deprivation of something essential to richness or productiveness.
{sc}bankrupt{/sc} suggests impoverishment to the point of imminent collapse.

pt.t: war had {it}bankrupted{/it} the nation of resources

et: Latin {it}depletus{/it}, past participle of {it}deplēre{/it}, from {it}de-{/it} + {it}plēre{/it} to fill {ma}{mat|full|}{/ma}
shortdef: to empty of a principal substance
to lessen markedly in quantity, content, power, or value
